text:
We're giving Pilate two days to dismantle the entire 
        apparatus of the Roman Imperialist State, and if he doesn't agree 
        immediately, we execute her.

name: FRANCIS
text:
Cut all her bits off. Send 'em back on the hour every 
        hour. Show them we're not to be trifled with.

name: REG
text:
Also, we're demanding a ten foot mahogany statue of the 
        Emperor Julius Caesar with his dock hangin' out.

name: LORETTA
text: What? They'll never agree to that, Reg.

name: REG
text:
That's just a bar-- a bargaining counter. And of course, 
        we point out that they bear full responsibility when we chop her up, and 
        that we shall not submit to blackmail!

name: REG
text:
They've bled us white, the bastards. They've taken 
        everything we had, and not just from us, from our fathers, and from our 
        fathers' fathers.

name: LORETTA
text: And from our fathers' fathers' fathers.

name: LORETTA
text: And from our fathers' fathers' fathers' fathers.

name: REG
text:
Yeah. All right, Stan. Don't labour the point. And what 
        have they ever given us in return?!

name: REG
text:
Oh. Yeah, yeah. They did give us that. Uh, that's true. 
        Yeah.

name: LORETTA
text:
Oh, yeah, the sanitation, Reg. Remember what the city 
        used to be like?

name: REG
text:
Yeah. All right. I'll grant you the aqueduct and the 
        sanitation are two things that the Romans have done.

name: REG
text:
Well, yeah. Obviously the roads. I mean, the roads go 
        without saying, don't they? But apart from the sanitation, the aqueduct, 
        and the roads--

name: REG
text: Yeah, yeah. All right. Fair enough.

name: FRANCIS
text:
Yeah. Yeah, that's something we'd really miss, Reg, 
        if the Romans left. Huh.

name: LORETTA
text:
And it's safe to walk in the streets at night now, 
        Reg.

name: FRANCIS
text:
Yeah, they certainly know how to keep order. Let's 
        face it. They're the only ones who could in a place like this.

name: COMMANDOS
text: Hehh, heh. Heh heh heh heh heh heh heh.

name: REG
text:
All right, but apart from the sanitation, the medicine, 
        education, wine, public order, irrigation, roads, a fresh water system, 
        and public health, what have the Romans ever done for us?

name: MATTHIAS
text:
I am a poor man. My sight is poor. My legs are old 
        and bent, and--

name: JUDITH
text: The first blow has been struck!

name: JUDITH
text:
A hundred times, in letters ten foot high, all the way 
        around the palace!

name: REG
text:
Oh, great. Great. We-- we need doers in our movement, 
        Brian, but, before you join us, know this. There is not one of us here 
        who would not gladly suffer death to rid this country of the Romans once 
        and for all.

name: REG
text:
Oh, yeah. Yeah, there's one, but otherwise, we're solid. 
        Are you with us?

name: REG
text:
From now on, you shall be called 'Brian that is called 
        Brian'. Tell him about the raid on Pilate's palace, Francis.

name: FRANCIS
text:
Now, this is the palace in Caesar's Square. Our 
        commando unit will approach from Fish Street, under cover of night, and 
        make our way to the northwestern main drain. If questioned, we are 
        sewage workers on our way to a conference. Reg, our glorious leader and 
        founder of the P.F.J., will be coordinating consultant at the drain 
        head, though he himself will not be taking part in any terrorist action, 
        as he has a bad back.

name: BRIAN
text: Aren't you going to come with us?

name: FRANCIS
text:
Once in the sewer, timing will be of the essence. 
        There is a Roman feast later in the evening, so we must move fast, and 
        don't wear your best sandals. Turning left here, we enter the 
        Caesar-Augustus memorial sewer and from there, proceed directly to the 
        hypocaust. This has just been re-tiled, so terrorists, careful with 
        those weapons. We will now be directly beneath Pilate's audience chamber 
        itself. This is the moment for Habbakuk to get out his prong.

name: FRANCIS
text: Oh. Uh, People's Front of Judea. Officials.

name: DEADLY DIRK
text:
We're going to kidnap Pilate's wife, take her 
        back, issue demands.

name: DEADLY DIRK
text: Yes, a couple of years ago!

name: FRANCIS
text:
Okay, c-- co-- come on. You got all your demands 
        worked out, then?

name: FRANCIS
text: Oh, come on. Pull the other one.

name: DEADLY DIRK
text:
That's not the point! We thought of it before 
        you!

name: DEADLY DIRK
text:
You bastards! We've been planning this for 
        months.

name: FRANCIS
text: Well, tough titty for you, Fish Face. Oh! Oh.

name: BRIAN
text: Brothers! Brothers! We should be struggling together!

name: BRIAN
text:
We mustn't fight each other! Surely we should be united 
        against the common enemy!

name: FRANCIS
text:
Yeah. He's right. Let's go in, get her out, and we 
        can argue afterwards.

name: COMMANDOS
text: Oh. Oh! Oh! Ohhh! Aaahh! Waahh! Ooh...

name: COMMANDO
text:
I got her. I got her. Quick. I got her! I-- I-- Uhm. 
        She got me. Help! She got me. She g--

name: COMMANDOS
text: Get the door! The door! Get the door! Good, I got--

name: FRANCIS
text: Uhh, you were going to punch me.

name: BEN
text: Proper little jailer's pet, aren't we?

name: BEN
text: You must have slipped him a few shekels, eh?

name: BRIAN
text: Slipped him a few shekels? You saw him spit in my face!

name: BEN
text:
Ohh! What wouldn't I give to be spat at in the face! I 
        sometimes hang awake at night dreaming of being spat at in the face.

name: BRIAN
text:
Well, it's not exactly friendly, is it? They had me in 
        manacles!

name: BEN
text:
Manacles! Ooh oooh oh oh. My idea of heaven is to be 
        allowed to be put in manacles... just for a few hours. They must think 
        the sun shines out o' your arse, sonny.

name: BRIAN
text: Oh, lay off me. I've had a hard time!

name: BEN
text:
You've had a hard time?! I've been here five years! They 
        only hung me the right way up yesterday! So, don't you come 'rou--

name: BEN
text: They must think you're Lord God Almighty.

name: BRIAN
text: What will they do to me?

name: BEN
text: Oh, you'll probably get away with crucifixion.

name: BEN
text: Best thing the Romans ever did for us.

name: BEN
text:
Oh, yeah. If we didn't have crucifixion, this country 
        would be in a right bloody mess.

name: BRIAN
text: I want you to move me to another cell.

name: BEN
text: Oh, look at that! Bloody favoritism!

name: BEN
text:
Now, take my case. They hung me up here five years ago. 
        Every night, they take me down for twenty minutes, then they hang me up 
        again, which I regard as very fair, in view of what I done, and, if 
        nothing else, it's taught me to respect the Romans, and it's taught 
        me... that you'll never get anywhere in this life, unless you're 
        prepared to do a fair day's work for a fair day's pay!

name: BRIAN
text: Pilate? What does he want to see me for?

name: CENTURION
text:
I think he wants to know which way up you want to 
        be crucified.

name: BEN
text:
Oh, ha ha ha haa! Ha haa! Nice one, Centurion. Like it. 
        Like it.

name: BEN
text: Right. Right. Terrific race, the Romans. Terrific.

name: PILATE
text: Ah. Thwow him to the floor.

name: PILATE
text: Hmm. Now, what is your name, Jew?

name: PILATE
text: Hoo hoo hoo ho. The little wascal has spiwit.

name: PILATE
text:
No, no. Spiwit, siw. Um, bwavado. A touch of 
        dewwing-do.

name: PILATE
text: So, you dare to waid us.

name: CENTURION
text: Oh, and, uh, throw him to the floor, sir?

name: CENTURION
text: Thwow him to the floor again, sir?

name: PILATE
text: Oh, yes. Thwow him to the floor, please.

name: BRIAN
text: I'm not Jewish. I'm a Roman.

name: PILATE
text: So, your father was a Woman. Who was he?

name: BRIAN
text: He was a centurion in the Jerusalem Garrisons.

name: PILATE
text:
Centuwion, do we have anyone of that name in the 
        gawwison?

name: PILATE
text: Well, you sound vewy sure. Have you checked?

name: CENTURION
text:
Well, no, sir. Umm, I think it's a joke, sir,... 
        like, uh, 'Sillius Soddus' or... 'Biggus Dickus', sir.

name: CENTURION
text: Well, it's a joke name, sir.

name: PILATE
text:
I have a vewy gweat fwiend in Wome called 'Biggus 
        Dickus'.

name: PILATE
text:
Silence! What is all this insolence? You will find 
        yourself in gladiator school vewy quickly with wotten behavior like 
        that.

name: PILATE
text: Wait till Biggus Dickus hears of this.

name: PILATE
text:
No, no. I want him fighting wabid, wild animals within 
        a week.

name: GUARD #4
text:
Ha ha haa ha, ha ha ha. Hooo hooo hoo hoo. Hoo 
        hoo...

name: PILATE
text:
I will not have my fwiends widiculed by the common 
        soldiewy. Anybody else feel like a little... giggle... when I mention my 
        fwiend... Biggus...

name: PILATE
text:
What about you? Do you find it... wisible... when I 
        say the name... 'Biggus'...

name: PILATE
text:
He has a wife, you know. You know what she's called? 
        She's called... 'Incontinentia'. 'Incontinentia Buttocks'.

name: GUARDS
text: Ha, ha ha ha ha ha...

name: PILATE
text:
I've had enough of this wowdy webel sniggewing 
        behavior. Silence! Call yourselves Pwaetowian guards? You're not-- 
        Seize him! Seize him! Blow your noses and seize him!

name: BLOOD & THUNDER PROPHET
text:
...And the bezan shall be huge and 
        black, and the eyes thereof red with the blood of living creatures, and 
        the whore of Babylon shall ride forth on a three-headed serpent, and 
        throughout the lands, there'll be a great rubbing of parts. Yeeah...

name: FALSE PROPHET
text:
...For the demon shall bear a nine-bladed 
        sword. Nine-bladed! Not two or five or seven, but nine, which he will 
        wield on all wretched sinners, sinners just like you, sir, there, and 
        the horns shall be on the head, with which he will...

name: BORING PROPHET
text:
...Obadiah, his servants. There shall, in that 
        time, be rumors of things going astray, erm, and there shall be a great 
        confusion as to where things really are, and nobody will really know 
        where lieth those little things wi-- with the sort of raffia work base 
        that has an attachment. At this time, a friend shall lose his friend's 
        hammer and the young shall not know where lieth the things possessed by 
        their fathers that their fathers put there only just the night before, 
        about eight o'clock. Yea, it is written in the book of Cyril that, in 
        that time, shall the third one...

name: HARRY THE HAGGLER
text: Well, we're-- we're supposed to haggle.

name: BRIAN
text: No, no. I've got to get--

name: HARRY THE HAGGLER
text: What do you mean, 'no, no, no'?

name: BRIAN
text: No, no, no. I just paid you.

name: BRIAN
text: All right. Do we have to?

name: HARRY THE HAGGLER
text: Now, look. I want twenty for that.

name: BRIAN
text: I-- I just gave you twenty.

name: HARRY THE HAGGLER
text:
Now, are you telling me that's not worth 
        twenty shekels?

name: HARRY THE HAGGLER
text:
Look at it. Feel the quality. That's none 
        of your goat.

name: BRIAN
text: All right. I'll give you nineteen then.

name: HARRY THE HAGGLER
text: No, no, no. Come on. Do it properly.

name: HARRY THE HAGGLER
text: Haggle properly. This isn't worth nineteen.

name: BRIAN
text: Well, you just said it was worth twenty.

name: HARRY THE HAGGLER
text: Ohh, dear. Ohh, dear. Come on. Haggle.

name: BRIAN
text: Huh. All right. I'll give you ten.

name: HARRY THE HAGGLER
text:
That's more like it. Ten?! Are you trying 
        to insult me?! Me, with a poor dying grandmother?! Ten?!

name: BRIAN
text: All right. I'll give you eleven.

name: HARRY THE HAGGLER
text:
Now you're gettin' it. Eleven?! Did I hear 
        you right?! Eleven?! This cost me twelve. You want to ruin me?!

name: HARRY THE HAGGLER
text: No, no. You go to fourteen now.

name: BRIAN
text: All right. I'll give you fourteen.

name: BRIAN
text: That's what you told me to say.

name: BRIAN
text: Ohh, tell me what to say. Please!

name: HARRY THE HAGGLER
text: He's offering me fourteen for this!

name: HARRY THE HAGGLER
text:
Seventeen. My last word. I won't take a 
        penny less, or strike me dead.

name: HARRY THE HAGGLER
text: Done. Nice to do business with you.

name: HARRY THE HAGGLER
text:
Tell you what. I'll throw you in this as 
        well.

name: BRIAN
text: I don't want it, but thanks.

name: BRIAN
text: All right! All right. All right.

name: HARRY THE HAGGLER
text: Now, where's the sixteen you owe me?

name: HARRY THE HAGGLER
text:
Oh, yeah. That's right. That's four I owe 
        you, then.

name: BRIAN
text: Well, that's all right. That's fine. That's fine.

name: HARRY THE HAGGLER
text: No. Hang on. I've got it here somewhere.

name: BRIAN
text: That's all right. That's four for the gourd.

name: HARRY THE HAGGLER
text:
Four? For this gourd? Four?! Look at it. 
        It's worth ten if it's worth a shekel.

name: BRIAN
text: But you just gave it to me for nothing.

name: HARRY THE HAGGLER
text:
No, no, no, no. It's not worth ten. You're 
        supposed to argue, 'Ten for that? You must be mad!' Ohh, well.

name: REG
text:
I now propose that all seven of these ex-brothers be now 
        entered in the minutes as probationary martyrs to the cause.

name: REG
text: Thank you, Loretta. On the nod. Siblings!

name: REG
text: Get off! Get off out of it!

name: BORING PROPHET
text:
Yea, verily, at that time, it is written in 
        the book of Obadiah. A man shall strike his donkey and his nephew's 
        donkey and anyone...

name: MATTHIAS
text: My eyes are dim. I cannot see.

name: CENTURION
text:
We have reason to believe you may be hiding one 
        Brian of Nazareth, a member of the terrorist organisation, the 'People's 
        Front of Judea'.

name: MATTHIAS
text:
Me? No. I'm just a poor old man. I have no time for 
        law-breakers. My legs are grey. My ears are gnarled. My eyes are old and 
        bent.

name: CENTURION
text: Quiet! Silly person. Guards! Search the house.

name: CENTURION
text: What do you mean, 'could be worse'?

name: CENTURION
text:
Stabbed? Takes a second. Crucifixion lasts hours! 
        It's a slow, horrible death!

name: MATTHIAS
text: Well, at least it gets you out in the open air.

name: SERGEANT
text: No, sir. Couldn't find anything, sir.

name: CENTURION
text:
But don't worry! You've not seen the last of us, 
        weirdo.

name: REG
text:
Ohhh, it's all right, siblings. He's sorry. He's sorry he 
        led the Fifth Legion straight to our official headquarters. Well, that's 
        all right, then, Brian. Sit down. Have a scone. Make yourself at home. 
        You klutz! You stupid, bird-brained, flat-headed--

name: MATTHIAS
text: My legs are old and bent. My ears are grizzled. Yes?

name: CENTURION
text: There's one place we didn't look. Guards!

name: MATTHIAS
text: I'm just a poor old man.

name: CENTURION
text: Have you ever seen anyone crucified?

name: CENTURION
text: Well done, Sergeant! We'll be back,... oddball.

name: MATTHIAS
text: You haven't given us time to hide.

name: FALSE PROPHET
text:
...And, a nine-bladed sword, which he shall 
        strike...

name: BLOOD & THUNDER PROPHET
text:
...Time when we all come together, 
        and go...

name: PROPHET IN WHITE
text: ...every bitch how you got germs from...

name: BRIAN
text:
Don't you, eh, pass judgment on other people, or you 
        might get judged yourself.

name: BRIAN
text:
I said, 'Don't pass judgment on other people, or else 
        you might get judged, too.'

name: COLIN
text: Oh. Ooh. Thank you very much.

name: BRIAN
text: Well, not just you. All of you.

name: DENNIS
text: How much do you want for the gourd?

name: BRIAN
text: I don't. You can have it.

name: DENNIS
text: Eh, d-- d-- don't you want to haggle?

name: ARTHUR
text: He says the birds are scrounging.

name: BRIAN
text:
Oh, uhh, no, the point is the birds. They do all right. 
        Don't they?

name: BRIAN
text:
Okay, and you're much more important than they are, 
        right? So, what are you worrying about? There you are. See?

name: EDDIE
text: I'm worrying about what you have got against birds.

name: BRIAN
text:
I haven't got anything against the birds. Consider the 
        lilies.

name: ARTHUR
text: He's having a go at the flowers now.

name: EDDIE
text: Oh, give the flowers a chance.

name: DENNIS
text: I'll give you one for it.

name: BRIAN
text: Ohh. Look. There was this man, and he had two servants.

name: BRIAN
text: I don't know. And he gave them some talents.

name: ARTHUR
text: He doesn't know what they were called!

name: BRIAN
text: Oh, they were called 'Simon' and 'Adrian'. Now--

name: BRIAN
text:
It really doesn't matter. The point is there were these 
        two servants--

name: ARTHUR
text: He's making it up as he goes along.

name: BRIAN
text:
No, I'm not! ...And he gave them some ta-- Wait a 
        minute. Were there three?

name: BRIAN
text: They were-- they were st-- stewards, really.

name: BRIAN
text:
Ooh! Eh, uh, b-- b-- now-- now hear this! Blessed are 
        they...

name: BRIAN
text:
...who convert their neighbor's ox, for they shall 
        inhibit their girth,...

name: BRIAN
text:
...and to them only shall be given-- to them only... 
        shall... be... given...

name: ELSIE
text: Hey! What were you going to say?

name: ELSIE
text: Yes. You were going to say something.

name: ARTHUR
text: Oh, come on. Tell us before you go.

name: BRIAN
text: I wasn't going to say anything. I'd finished.

name: EDDIE
text: Must be. Otherwise, he'd tell us.

name: GIRL
text: Is it the secret of eternal life?

name: ARTHUR
text:
Well, of course not. If I knew the secret of eternal 
        life, I wouldn't say.

name: ARTHUR
text: No. Tell us, Master. We were here first.

name: GIRL
text:
It is His gourd! We will carry it for you, Master! 
        Master?

name: YOUTH
text: He's gone! He's been taken up!

name: ARTHUR
text: No, there He is. Over there.

name: ARTHUR
text: He has given us a sign!

name: SHOE FOLLOWER
text: He has given us... His shoe!

name: ARTHUR
text: The shoe is the sign. Let us follow His example.

name: ARTHUR
text:
Let us, like Him, hold up one shoe and let the other 
        be upon our foot, for this is His sign, that all who follow Him shall do 
        likewise.

name: SHOE FOLLOWER
text: No, no, no. The shoe is...

name: SHOE FOLLOWER
text:
...a sign that we must gather shoes together in 
        abundance.

name: SHOE FOLLOWER
text: No! Let us gather shoes together!

name: YOUTH
text:
No, no! It is a sign that, like Him, we must think not 
        of the things of the body, but of the face and head!

name: GIRL
text: Follow the Gourd! The Holy Gourd of Jerusalem!

name: HARRY
text: Hold up the sandal, as He has commanded us!

name: ARTHUR
text: It is a shoe! It is a shoe!

name: SHOE FOLLOWER
text: Take the shoes and follow Him!

name: SPIKE
text:
Stop! Stop! Stop, I say! Stop! Let us-- let us pray. 
        Yea, He cometh to us, like the seed to the grain.

name: BRIAN
text:
Hey! Is there another way down? Is there another path 
        down to the river?

name: BRIAN
text: Please! Please help me! I've got to get--

name: SIMON
text: Oh, damn, damn, and blast it!

name: SIMON
text:
Don't you 'shhhh' me. Eighteen years of total silence, 
        and you 'shhhh' me!

name: SIMON
text:
I've kept my vow for eighteen years. Not a single, 
        recognisable, articulate sound has passed my lips.

name: BRIAN
text:
Oh, please. Could you be quiet for another five 
        minutes?

name: SIMON
text:
Oh, it doesn't matter now. I might as well enjoy 
        myself. The times in the last eighteen years I've wanted to shout and 
        sing and...

name: SIMON
text: ...scream my name out! Oh, I'm alive!

name: SIMON
text:
Hava Nagila! Hava Nagila, ha ha ha! Look out. Oh, I'm 
        alive! I'm alive! Hello birds! Hello trees! I'm alive! Get off. I'm 
        alive! Hava Nagila. Hava n'ra n'--

name: SHOE FOLLOWER
text: The Master! Aha. He is here!

name: ARTHUR
text: The shoe has led us to Him!

name: ARTHUR and HARRY
text: Speak to us, Master! Speak to us!

name: ARTHUR
text: How shall we go away, Master?!

name: BRIAN
text: Oh, just go away! Leave me alone!

name: ARTHUR
text:
He has given us a sign! He has brought us to this 
        place!

name: BRIAN
text: I didn't bring you here! You just followed me!

name: SHOE FOLLOWER
text: Oh, it's still a good sign by any standard.

name: ARTHUR
text:
Master! Your people have walked many miles to be with 
        You! They are weary and have not eaten.

name: BRIAN
text: It's not my fault they haven't eaten!

name: ARTHUR
text: There is no food in this high mountain!

name: BRIAN
text: Well, what about the juniper bushes over there?

name: FOLLOWERS
text: Heh! A miracle! A miracle! Ohh!...

name: SHOE FOLLOWER
text: He has made the bush fruitful by His words.

name: YOUTH
text: They have brought forth juniper berries.

name: BRIAN
text:
Of course they've brought forth juniper berries! 
        They're juniper bushes! What do you expect?!

name: ARTHUR
text:
Do not tempt Him, shallow ones! Is not the miracle of 
        the juniper bushes enough?!

name: SIMON
text: I say, those are my juniper bushes.

name: ARTHUR
text: They are a gift from God!

name: SIMON
text:
They're all I've bloody got to eat. Uhm. I say, get off 
        those bushes! Go on! Clear off, the lot of you. Go on.

name: HARRY
text: Lord! I am affected by a bald patch.

name: BLIND MAN
text: I am healed! The Master has healed me!

name: BLIND MAN
text: I was blind, and now I can see! Aargh!

name: FOLLOWERS
text: A miracle! A miracle! A miracle!

name: SIMON
text:
Tell them to stop it. I hadn't said a word for eighteen 
        years till he came along.

name: FOLLOWERS
text: A miracle! He is the Messiah!

name: FOLLOWERS
text: Hurt my foot, Lord! Hurt my foot. Hurt mine...

name: ARTHUR
text:
I say You are, Lord, and I should know. I've followed 
        a few.

name: BRIAN
text:
I'm not the Messiah! Will you please listen? I am not 
        the Messiah, do you understand?! Honestly!

name: GIRL
text: Only the true Messiah denies His divinity.

name: BRIAN
text:
What?! Well, what sort of chance does that give me? All 
        right! I am the Messiah!

name: FOLLOWERS
text: He is! He is the Messiah!

name: ARTHUR
text: How shall we fuck off, O Lord?

name: BRIAN
text: Oh, just go away! Leave me alone.

name: SIMON
text:
You told these people to eat my juniper berries. You 
        break my bloody foot. You break my vow of silence, and then you try and 
        clean up on my juniper bushes!

name: ARTHUR
text: This is the Messiah, the Chosen One!

name: FOLLOWERS
text: Kill the heretic! Kill him! Persecute! Kill!...

name: BRIAN
text:
Leave him alone! Leave him alone! Leave him alone. Put

Always look on the right 
        side of life,

name: MR. FRISBEE
text:
For life is quite absurd And death's the final 
        word. You must always face the curtain with a bow. Forget about your 
        sin. Give the audience a grin.

name: EVERYONE
text:
Enjoy it. It's your last 
        chance, anyhow. So,...

name: MR. FRISBEE
text:
Life's a piece of shit, When you look at it. 
        Life's a laugh and death's a joke. It's true. You'll see it's all a 
        show. Keep 'em laughing as you go. Just remember that the last laugh is 
        on you. And...

name: EVERYONE
text: Always look on the bright side of life.

text: Always look on the bright side of life!

name: MR. FRISBEE
text: Worse things happen at sea, you know.

text: Always look on the bright side of life!

name: MR. FRISBEE
text: I mean, what you got to lose? You know, you come from nothing.

name: MR. FRISBEE
text: You're going back to nothing. What have you lost? Nothing!

name: EVERYONE
text: Always look on the bright side of life!

name: MR. FRISBEE
text: Nothing will come from nothing. You know what they say?

name: EVERYONE
text: Always look on the bright side of life!

name: MR. FRISBEE
text: Cheer up, you old bugger. Come on. Give us a grin. There you are. See?

name: MR. FRISBEE
text: It's the end of the film. Incidentally, this record's available in the foyer.

name: EVERYONE
text: Always look on the bright side of life!

name: MR. FRISBEE
text: Some of us have got to live as well, you know.

name: MR. FRISBEE
text: Who do you think pays for all this rubbish?

name: EVERYONE
text: Always look on the bright side of life!

name: MR. FRISBEE
text: They'll never make their money back, you know. I told him.

name: MR. FRISBEE
text: I said to him, 'Bernie.' I said, 'They'll never make their money back.'

name: EVERYONE
text: Always look on the bright side of life!
